oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Genomic methods in analyzing the communities of soil bacteria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blasco, Lucia
Kahala, Minna
Palojärvi, Ansa
Joutsjoki, Vesa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Culture-independent examination of complex microbial communities has been made possible by recent advances in molecular biology. Terminal restriction fragment length polymorphism is one of such techniques that allow rapid assessment of the diversity of microbial community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Blasco, Lucia; Kahala, Minna; Palojärvi, Ansa and Joutsjoki, Vesa (2008) Genomic methods in analyzing the communities of soil bacteria. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 4 (3), p. 4.
